name: Introduction to Sociology
description: This course provides a general introduction to the field of sociology and its major theories, research methods, and debates.

name: Environmental Sociology
description: This course covers the theoretical and empirical basis of environmental sociology, the study of the complex relationships between society and the natural environment.

name: Environmental Politics & Policy
description: This course examines the various political and policy processes that shape environmental issues and the ways in which people interact with the environment.

name: Ecological Economics
description: This course focuses on the economic analysis of the environment and natural resources, examining the relationships between economic development, environmental degradation, and sustainable development.
